author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin with conservancy workers at R.K. Nagar in Chennai on Wednesday.— Photo: B. Jothi Ramalingam

DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin on Wednesday said his party would cobble together a strong alliance for the 2016 Assembly elections.

Mr. Stalin, who resumed his fourth phase of ‘ Namakku Naame ’ campaign in Chief Minister Jayalalithaa’s R.K. Nagar Assembly constituency in Chennai by meeting conservancy workers, said whether Vijayakant’s DMDK would be part of the DMK-led alliance would be known only after the date for elections is announced.

“Our leader will announce the party’s strategy and programme for the election,” he said.

Mr. Stalin said Ms. Jayalalithaa should meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi to prevail upon him to take steps to conduct jallikattu this year. “Merely writing letters will not serve any purpose,” he said.
title: ‘DMK will form a strong alliance’
